alert.note: Alert for Arches, Grand Flat; Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 1:41PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central San Juan, southeastern Uintah and central Grand Counties through 215 PM MDT... At 140 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 36 miles southwest of Rangely to 21 miles east of Green River to 16 miles southwest of Canyonlands National Park. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of north central San Juan, southeastern Uintah and central Grand Counties, including the following locations... Arches National Park and Dead Horse Point State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Utah between mile markers 183 and 209. U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 125 and 155. Utah 128 between mile markers 0 and 5, between mile markers 9 and 12, and between mile markers 42 and 44. Utah 279 between mile markers 0 and 15. Utah 313 between mile markers 0 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Arches, Grand Flat; Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; Tavaputs Plateau
